pullRequest.body:
For `ε : ℝ≥0∞`, define `ε`-separated sets as those sets `s` for which the distance between any two points of `s` is at least `ε`.

From my PhD (MiscYD)


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise

nodes.body:
### PR summary [430f50aa29](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23110/commits/430f50aa29237af52e183e260114188416d33648)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsSeparated`
`+ IsSeparated.anti`
`+ IsSeparated.empty`
`+ IsSeparated.insert`
`+ IsSeparated.of_subsingleton`
`+ IsSeparated.singleton`
`+ IsSeparated.subset`
`+ _root_.Set.Subsingleton.isSeparated`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Let's make it even clearer here that the two notions are genuinely different from each other: one is about points in a set being separated and the other is about sets themselves being separated
(we discussed stuff like this elsewhere, I quite like this pattern)
Do you want to make some `Antitone`? I don't have a strong feeling either way.
I think it would be more confusing than helpful
Perhaps an `insert_of_not_mem` which should be easy from `Pairwise.insert_of_symmetric_of_not_mem`
Actually, it strikes me that `Pairwise.insert_of_symmetric_of_not_mem` is strictly weaker than `Pairwise.insert_of_symmetric` and that the `a ∉ s` is unnecessary. Maybe we should just delete it?

It's weaker, but I think it's worth having around as a convenience lemma. Specifically see [`Set.pairwise_insert_of_symmetric_of_not_mem`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Pairwise/Basic.html#Set.pairwise_insert_of_symmetric_of_not_mem), which I think should stay (but has a bad name). The point is that most of the time when you use `insert`, it's when it's a new element, and in that case the pairwise_insert_iff lemma has a nicer formulation.
Yes so the iff version is worth having, but the mpr direction is silly and we don't want it, right?

pullRequest.title: feat: metric-separated sets
